author: nishant0
content: That is cosmetic, so you can ignore it

author: jimmygchen

author: nishant0
content: just means we don't recognize the field in the yaml config

author: jimmygchen
content:
looks like there's still a metadata mismatch between LH and Prysm - lighthouse is expecting 8 bytes (uint64) but missing 7 bytes

```
[cl-2-lighthouse-geth] Sep 04 00:24:11.416 DEBG RPC Error                               direction: Outgoing, score: 0, peer_id: 16Uiu2HAmQYLCMts8LXgTWfFmv8tp7vCe3juTAJroY2Jiosz9nT3G, client: Unknown, err: Error while decoding ssz: InvalidByteLength { len: 18, expected: 25 }, protocol: metadata, service: libp2p
```

should the `custody_subnet_count` field here be `uint64`? 
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/751a7a00eee00f70bfe1a92147f2aa8162c48f54/proto/prysm/v1alpha1/p2p_messages.pb.go#L359

author: jimmygchen
content:
ah yeah never mind,  i see an open PR to update this
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/14415

author: manunlp
content:
```yaml
participants:
# Super nodes
  - cl_type: prysm
    cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerDAS-ec35840
    cl_max_mem: 4096
    cl_extra_params:
      - --subscribe-all-subnets
      - --minimum-peers-per-subnet=1
  - cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:unstable-4e675cf
    cl_extra_params:
      - --subscribe-all-data-column-subnets
  - cl_type: teku
    cl_image: ethpandaops/teku:nashatyrev-das-7725aa9
    cl_extra_params: 
      - --p2p-subscribe-all-custody-subnets-enabled
# Full nodes
  - cl_type: prysm
    cl_image: ethpandaops/prysm-beacon-chain:peerDAS-ec35840
    cl_max_mem: 4096
    cl_extra_params:
      - --minimum-peers-per-subnet=1
      - --data-columns-withhold-count=64
  - cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:unstable-4e675cf
  - cl_type: teku
    cl_image: ethpandaops/teku:nashatyrev-das-7725aa9
network_params:
  eip7594_fork_epoch: 0
  eip7594_fork_version: "0x50000038"
snooper_enabled: true
global_log_level: debug
additional_services:
  - dora
  - goomy_blob
  - prometheus_grafana
dora_params:
  image: ethpandaops/dora:peerdas-as-deneb
ethereum_metrics_exporter_enabled: true
```

author: manunlp
content:
<@199561711278227457> for information I modified my pinned message with kurtosis config by adding this flag on the Prysm full node:
```
- --data-columns-withhold-count=64
```
--> When the Prysm full node proposes a block, it actually withhold 64 columns out of 128. It forces super nodes to reconstruct the missing 64 data columns from the 64 one sent by the block proposer, and to broadcast them to the network.

I think this flag was already used in the previous devnet.

It adds these logs in the Prysm full node:
```
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=0 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=0
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=1 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=1
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=2 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=2
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=3 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=3
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=4 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=4
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=5 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=5
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=6 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=6
[2024-09-04 10:16:57.07]  WARNING rpc/validator: Withholding data column dataColumnIndex=7 root=0x400c1162a5cd820af3c2452d8e7a9f52c9c4d5db1b1c1ab00cbe11009e75ab56 slot=20 subnet=7
...
```

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
`--data-storage-mode=prune` for teku will do it (if you don't need states, only blocks)
we have extension for blobSidecars store epochs with separate flag, but have not added anything for DataColumnSidecars yet, so no option to extend storing period for DataColumnSidecars for Teku
